clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Immunogenicity, Reatogenicity and Safety of Double Viral Vaccine (MR) for Measles and Rubella
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II / III, Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Immunogenicity, Reatogenicity and Safety of Double Viral Vaccine (MR) for Measles and Rubella, Produced by Bio-Manguinhos / Fiocruz in 11-month-old Infants.

lead_sponsor.agency: The Immunobiological Technology Institute (Bio-Manguinhos) / Oswaldo Cruz Foundation (Fiocruz)

clinical_study.source: The Immunobiological Technology Institute (Bio-Manguinhos) / Oswaldo Cruz Foundation (Fiocruz)

brief_summary.textblock: Measles and rubella are highly contagious acute viral diseases. As per WHO, several evidences demonstrate the benefit for providing the universal access to vaccines containing measles and rubella antigens, mainly due to, respectively, mortality in children and malformations in fetuses. This is a Phase I-III, Controlled, randomized and double blind for the evaluation double viral vaccine anti-measles and rubella (MR), which is developed and produced at Instituto de Tecnologia em Imunobiologicos Bio-Manguinhos/Fiocruz, in Brazil, for use in human beings. 432 eligible volunteers (11-month-old infants), will be vaccinated and monitored for local and systemic adverse events and titration of antibodies. The study will last 11 months in total.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a Phase II-III, controlled, randomized and double blind for the evaluation of a double viral vaccine anti measles and rubella (MR), which is under the development at Instituto de Tecnologia em Imunobiologicos Bio-Manguinhos/Fiocruz, in Brazil, for use in human beings. 432 eligible volunteers (11-month-old infants), will be vaccinated and monitored for local and systemic adverse events and immunogenicity. The study will last 11 months in total.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Two intervention groups (MR vaccine and MMR vaccine), with 1 dose of vaccine in each group.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity analysis of the study vaccine
primary_outcome.time_frame: 42 days after the 1st dose of MR or MMR
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate imune response between post and pre-vaccination antibodies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Reatogenicity analysis of the study vaccine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days after the 1st dose of MR or MMR
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the occurrence of serious adverse events among individuals who received MR and MMR vaccines.

arm_group.description: Biological/Vaccine: Administration of the experimental vaccine (Measles and Rubella).
Biological/Vaccine: Administration of the comparator vaccine (Measles, Mumps and Rubella).
